content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Certainly! Here is the function `extract_julia_code` in Julia:

```julia
using Markdown

function extract_julia_code(md::AbstractString)
    doc = MD.parse(md)
    filtered_cells = filter(cell -> occursin(r"\`\``julia\`\``", cell), doc.content)
    if isempty(filtered_cells)
        return ""
    end
    julia_code = join([filter(x -> occursin(r"\`\``julia\`\``", x), cell.content) for cell in filtered_cells], "\n")
    return julia_code
end
```

This function first parses the markdown document into a Markdown.jl document object. It then filters out the cells where the code block language is specified as "julia". If there are no such cells, an empty string is returned. Otherwise, it extracts the code block content and joins them together with newlines.

This function assumes that the input is a string containing markdown text.
